conclusion: Analyze how liquid flows from points A, B, and C into containers D or E considering baffles.
Point A is connected to a light blue pipe.
Point B is connected to an orange pipe.
Point C is connected to a pink pipe.
First set of baffles: white horizontal baffle near center, purple baffle below white, yellow baffle on right above containers.
Light blue liquid flows down towards the white baffle.
Light blue liquid hits white baffle and gets deflected downwards.
Orange liquid flows down towards the white baffle.
Orange liquid hits white baffle and gets deflected downwards.
Pink liquid flows directly towards the yellow baffle.
Pink liquid hits yellow baffle and gets deflected downwards.
Second set of baffles closer to bottom of image.
Light blue liquid continues past purple baffle towards left side where container D is located.
Orange liquid follows similar path to light blue liquid towards left side where container D is located.
Pink liquid flows towards right side where container E is located.
Light blue and orange liquids flow into container D.
Pink liquid flows into container E.
Container D will receive liquid from points A and B; container E will receive liquid from point C.
